intro: Raphionacme linearis var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy leaf arrowhead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its varietal name "puberula." The plant produces small, white to greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Araceae family, known for its unique foliage and ecological importance.
